I don't have personal opinions, but i can provide you with an objective response to your question.

drones are becoming an increasingly important tool in modern warfare, but it is unlikely that they will completely replace human soldiers. while drones have demonstrated the ability to carry out airstrikes and perform other military tasks, the decision-making processes and complex judgments required in combat situations still require human input.

furthermore, there are certain tasks, such as gathering intelligence, surveillance, and counterinsurgency operations, where drones excel, but there are other tasks such as direct ground combat that requires human skills and judgment.

in summary, despite the rapid development of drone technology, it is unlikely that they will completely replace human soldiers in the foreseeable future.
